properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 10:53PM EST until February 12 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the French Broad River...

...near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties

Forecasted rainfall of 2-4 inches across the Upper French Broad River
will occur over saturated soils through early Tuesday afternoon.
French Broad River levels are still elevated following heavy rainfall
late last week, therefore, the forecasted rainfall will cause yet
another round of significant rises along the French Broad River.
Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the river from Etowah,
to Horse Shoe, to Mills River, to Avery Creek are expected to begin
on Tuesday and may persist through Thursday.  More significant river
rises are possible so concerned residents are encouraged to follow the
latest forecasts and product updates for the latest information.

The Flood Advisory continues for
the French Broad River Near Fletcher
* until Tuesday morning.
* At 10 PM Monday the stage was 9.0 feet and falling slowly.
* Action Stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 13.0 feet.
* FORECAST: The river will rise to near 11.7 feet by early Wednesday
morning.
* IMPACTS: At 12.0 feet: Action Stage continues.  Glenn Bridge Park
river access is experiencing minor flooding.  Westfeldt Park is
experiencing scattered flooding.  French Broad River floodwaters
are causing isolated to widely scattered farmland flooding.
* IMPACTS: At 11.5 feet: Action Stage Flooding continues.  Butler
Bridge Rd. is inundated with up to 6 inches of floodwaters from the
French Broad River, forcing road closure.
* IMPACTS: At 10.0 feet: Action/Advisory Stage.  The French Broad
River has exceeded bankfull at the gauge site.  Isolated farmland
flooding is beginning across the French Broad River Valley from
Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp

A Flood Advisory for a river forecast point means that nuisance
flooding is expected to occur along the river when the river level is
forecast to be just below or at the official Minor Flood Stage.
